summary: Retry policy intervals specified in milliseconds (e.g., 500ms) are incorrectly rounded down to zero seconds when sent to the server. The SDK should round up durations like other SDKs do.
userImpact: Activities configured with sub-second retry intervals fail to retry correctly, causing activities to not retry as intended.
rootCause: Duration values are being rounded down to the nearest second instead of rounding up, resulting in zero-valued durations for millisecond intervals.
proposedFix: Round up durations to the nearest second instead of rounding down, consistent with other SDK implementations.
resolutionDetails: Issue was resolved on the server side via temporal PR #1681 and validated in SDK PR #1121.
keyQuote: The SDK should probably round up the durations (first check what the other SDKs do here).
